form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Toomey (for himself, Mr. Schumer, Mr. Portman, and Mr. Casey) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Safe Drinking Water Act to exempt fire hydrants from the prohibition on the use of lead pipes, fittings, fixtures, solder, and flux.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Community Fire Safety Act of 2013 .

section.header: Exempting fire hydrants from prohibition on use of lead
Evaluation of sources of lead in water distribution systems and alternate routing systems
section.text: The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency shall—

paragraph.text: consult with and seek the advice of the National Drinking Water Advisory Council on potential changes to the regulations pertaining to lead under the Safe Drinking Water Act ( 42 U.S.C. 300f et seq.); and

request the National Drinking Water Advisory Council to consider sources of lead throughout drinking water distribution systems, including through components used to reroute drinking water during distribution system repairs.
